trans-unit.source: Represents the local print server (the computer on which your application is running) and enables management of its print queues.

When your application writes a value to a property of the LocalPrintServer object, that change has no effect until the value is passed to the computer that is represented by the LocalPrintServer object.
To ensure that the change in value takes effect, use the <xref:System.Printing.LocalPrintServer.Commit%2A> method.
In addition, other applications may also change the print service properties of the computer.
To ensure that the LocalPrintServer object used by your application has the latest actual values, use the <xref:System.Printing.LocalPrintServer.Refresh%2A> method.
> [!CAUTION] > Classes within the <xref:System.Printing> namespace are not supported for use within a Windows service or ASP.NET application or service.
Attempting to use these classes from within one of these application types may produce unexpected problems, such as diminished service performance and run-time exceptions.
If you want to print from a Windows Forms application, see the <xref:System.Drawing.Printing> namespace.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Printing.LocalPrintServer"></xref> class.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Printing.LocalPrintServer"></xref> class that has the specified <xref href="System.Printing.LocalPrintServerIndexedProperty"></xref> array.
An array of properties that the constructor initializes.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Printing.LocalPrintServer"></xref> class that has the specified <xref href="System.Printing.PrintSystemDesiredAccess"></xref>.
A value specifying the type of access to the print server that your application needs.
desiredAccess is a value that can be applied only to a object, not a object.
For example, <xref href="System.Printing.PrintSystemDesiredAccess"></xref>.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Printing.LocalPrintServer"></xref> class that has the specified properties.
An array of the property names that the constructor initializes.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Printing.LocalPrintServer"></xref> class that has the specified <xref href="System.Printing.LocalPrintServerIndexedProperty"></xref> array and the specified <xref href="System.Printing.PrintSystemDesiredAccess"></xref>.
An array of properties that the constructor initializes.
A value specifying the type of access to the print server that your program needs.
desiredAccess is a value that can be applied only to a object, not a object.
For example, <xref href="System.Printing.PrintSystemDesiredAccess"></xref>.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Printing.LocalPrintServer"></xref> class that has the specified properties and <xref href="System.Printing.PrintSystemDesiredAccess"></xref>.
An array of the property names that the constructor initializes.
A value specifying the type of access to the print server that your application needs.
desiredAccess is a value that can be applied only to a object, not a object.
For example, <xref href="System.Printing.PrintSystemDesiredAccess"></xref>.
Writes any changes that your application made to the properties of the <xref href="System.Printing.LocalPrintServer"></xref> to the actual print server that the object represents.
The method requires that the <xref:System.Printing.LocalPrintServer> object be created with <xref:System.Printing.PrintSystemDesiredAccess> rights.
Some properties are not committed.
Connects the local print server to the specified <xref href="System.Printing.PrintQueue"></xref>.
The print queue to connect.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the connection is made; otherwise <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
A print queue that matches the property of the printer is not found.
Connects to the print queue that is specified by using the <xref:System.String>.
The full path of the print queue that is being connected.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the connection is made; otherwise <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
A print queue with the specified path is not found.
Gets or sets the default print queue.

Your application will have only <xref:System.Printing.PrintSystemDesiredAccess> access to the default queue, even if you have <xref:System.Printing.PrintSystemDesiredAccess> rights to the print server.
To open the queue with greater access, use one of the <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue.%23ctor%2A> constructors that enables you to specify the desired access level.
The <xref href="System.Printing.PrintQueue"></xref> that is designated as the default queue for the local computer.
Disconnects the local print server from the specified <xref href="System.Printing.PrintQueue"></xref>.
The print queue that is being disconnected.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the disconnection is successful; otherwise <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
A print queue matching the property of the printer is not found.
Disconnects from the print queue that is specified in the <xref:System.String>.
The full path to the print queue that is disconnected.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the disconnection is successful; otherwise <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
A print queue with the specified path is not found.
Returns a reference to the default print queue of the <xref href="System.Printing.LocalPrintServer"></xref>.

Your application will have only <xref:System.Printing.PrintSystemDesiredAccess> access to the default queue, even if you have <xref:System.Printing.PrintSystemDesiredAccess> rights to the print server.
To open the queue with greater access, use one of the <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue.%23ctor%2A> constructors that enables you to specify the desired access level.
The default <xref href="System.Printing.PrintQueue"></xref>.
Updates the properties of the <xref href="System.Printing.LocalPrintServer"></xref> object so that their values match the values of the print server that the object represents.

Any changes that you make to <xref:System.Printing.LocalPrintServer> properties that are not written to the print server by using the <xref:System.Printing.LocalPrintServer.Commit%2A> method are lost when Refresh runs.
Some properties did not update.
